abstract: Apple’s recent problems with the iPhone, MobileMe and the Macbook Air aren’t unusual. The company has always struggled with occasional technical issues — just like its competitors.
snippet: Apple’s recent problems with the iPhone, MobileMe and the Macbook Air aren’t unusual. The company has always struggled with occasional technical issues — just like its competitors.
lead_paragraph: For Apple, these are the best of times and the worst of times.

abstract: My wireless home network used to be fine, but I have noticed that it has recently gotten periodically slower. What might be causing this drop in speed?
snippet: My wireless home network used to be fine, but I have noticed that it has recently gotten periodically slower. What might be causing this drop in speed?
lead_paragraph: Q. My wireless home network used to be fine, but I have noticed that it has recently gotten periodically slower. What might be causing this drop in speed?

abstract: Want to turn the Mac’s screensaver into a dynamic billboard for news headlines, favorite blog feeds or even Facebook notifications?
snippet: Want to turn the Mac’s screensaver into a dynamic billboard for news headlines, favorite blog feeds or even Facebook notifications?
lead_paragraph: Want to turn the Mac’s screensaver into a dynamic billboard for news headlines, favorite blog feeds or even Facebook notifications? Go to the System Preferences area in Mac OS X 10.4 or 10.5 and click on the Desktop and Screen Saver icon. Click the Screen Saver tab, choose RSS Visualizer and click the Options button to select a news feed to display when the screen saver kicks on. Windows users can find a number of shareware programs around the Web that do the same thing, including NuParadigm’s free RSS Screensaver software at www.nuparadigm.com/Products/Toys/RssScreensaver.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Adding RSS Feeds to Your Screensaver
